head.title: Home - Frankfort Community Unit School District 168

input.name: __VIEWSTATE
__VIEWSTATEGENERATOR

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

span.style: font-family: "Times New Roman",serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Friday, April 17, 2020 4:45 p.m. (Day 35)

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Dear Families of Frankfort CUSD #168:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: As you know, I did not plan to post a message today, but with the Governors announcement this afternoon that in-person schooling will be suspended for the rest of this school year, I thought that I should send a note.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Please know that this is not the way any of us hoped to see the last few weeks of this school year. As our faculty and staff have been working with our meal distribution program and our remote learning plans these past few weeks, we hoped that we were going through something temporary and that we would see everyone back in class soon. We know a lot of work was done in class and in extracurricular activities throughout this school year and we hoped to recognize that work and finish together in person. Just as you as students miss being together and going through end of the year field trips, walks to the park, dinners, and ceremonies, all of us on staff miss being together with you and participating in those activities, too.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: I know there will be a lot of questions about end of year activities including Prom and Graduations. At this point, no decisions have been made. We want to have all of these activities. With this announcement coming on a Friday afternoon, we still have a lot to discuss and work through to develop alternative ideas to hold these events in some way, shape, or form. We will have more news on our options no earlier than the end of the day on Wednesday, April 22. I know that all of us in this community will do all we can to make this work, hold the events and ceremonies to mark the end of the year, and keep everyone safe.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Everyone is pulling together to make it through this and support our students. Thanks goes to all of the families across our District as we all work together through this. We should be proud of the efforts so far and know that when we look back on this time, that we did all we could to help each other through it.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: This should hopefully be the last message until Sunday night. Again, have a good weekend.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Sincerely,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Matt Donkin

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Superintendent of Schools

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;;font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: 16px;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: PRESS RELEASE ** PRESS RELEASE ** PRESS RELEASE

span.style: text-decoration: underline;;font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Friday, April 17, 2020

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: Frankfort Community Unit School District to Hold Regular Meeting on Monday, April 20

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: As stated in the original calendar for the year, the Regular Meeting of the Frankfort CUSD #168 Board of Education will be held on Monday, April 20, 2020, at 6 p.m. in the Library at Central Junior High School, located at 1500 East Ninth Street in West Frankfort. Due to the Executive Order that resulted from the COVID-19 shut down to keep social distancing standards and meet the requirements of the Open Meetings Act, there will be public access to this meeting by calling (812) 727-7576 and using the PIN 852 200 315#.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: The agenda can be found at the districts website,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: , under the School Board tab at Board Minutes.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Contact: Matt Donkin, Superintendent of Schools

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: 16px;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Dear Families of Frankfort CUSD #168:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: As we move through Day 34, weve noticed something that is always a challenge for us at school. How do we best teach and instruct our students of all ability levels at the same time? With the release of so many education packets at the once, it drives that point home even more. As we have worked to try to find that Baby Bear / Goldilocks / Just Right spot to challenge and yet be sensitive to learning challenges that each student has, we appreciate your patience and understanding. We do understand the issues that everyone is facing. Again, if you have questions or concerns about getting through material, please contact your teachers during their office hours. This initial work is due back to us by Monday, April 27, but, if there are still questions, teachers will continue to work with their students. Just be sure to ask.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: If you still havent received a packet, please call your individual school and leave a message so we can get in touch and figure out the best way for you to get material. Then, to review from yesterday:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Meal Distribution will happen again on Friday from 11 a.m. to 12 noon at our regular 8 locations listed below. This is lunch for tomorrow and breakfast for the next day.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: How can I get the materials?

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: On Individual School Buildings Web Sites.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: - or -

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: A hard copy / paper and pencil form from schools or meal buses.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: At DES/FIS/CJHS/FCHS: 10 a.m. to 12 noon

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: At Other Food Distribution Sites: 11 a.m. to 12 noon

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

em.span: For our General Education students in grades Kindergarten through 8th Grade:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Packets and Documents Available On-Line.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Packets will be available at ALL Food Distribution Sites.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

em.span: For our General Education students at Frankfort Community High School:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: If you need a paper and pencil packet call the school at 618-932-3126 and leave a message that you will need a copy and if you will be 1) coming to the school or 2) meeting a meal bus.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: You may also email Mr. Dial or Mrs. Sullivan.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif; color: blue;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: : School pick-up will now be with the food on the East Side of the High School on Locust Street.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

em.span: For all of our Students Receiving Special Education and Speech-Language Services in Grades Early Childhood through Seniors:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Your individualized packets will be available at the school your child attends.If you cannot make it to the individual school, please call that school and we will make arrangements to place those packets on your closest meal distribution bus. Please be sure to let staff know that your childs packet has their name on it.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: How Do I Receive Credit for These Assignments?

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Assignments on the packets should be completed as correctly as you can get them to the best of each students ability.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: What If I Struggle with the Work and Have Problems Completing Packets Correctly?

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: This is where it is important to contact your teacher for help.This is why we are making Office Hours available.Our teachers will be more than happy to help you through your assignments so that they are good to go when you turn them in.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: How Should I Turn in My Packets to the Schools? (2 Options)

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Scan your packet information from each class and send it electronically to your teachers.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Return it to any of the 4 schools or any of the daily meal buses.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: **If you have other problems getting your packets back, please call your school to talk.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: How Will Grades Count for This Completed Material?

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: All Students Received a 3rd Quarter Grade on the most recent Report Card.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: If students successfully complete all of their assignment packets, over the next 6 weeks, they will receive a P for Pass.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Students who receive a P will have a chance to move their 3rd Quarter Grade up one letter grade for their final Semester Grade.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Students who do not complete their work will receive their 3rd Quarter Grade as their Semester Grade.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: If I Like My Quarter 3 Grade, Why Should I Do the Work?

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: This event will be over and our students have the chance to move on to the next grade or class.What you learn now will be needed for those classes to start in the future with less review time so that learning can continue as before.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: For Seniors, whether going on to higher education, the military, or the elsewhere into the world, this work and these lessons are still important for the next stage of your life.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Other students across the country are dealing with the same circumstances.How a person reacts to this and the work ethic they show has a chance to be beneficial for them in the future.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: As a reminder, the food distribution sites are at the Yellow School Bus at the Following Locations:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Frankfort Intermediate School

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Frankfort Community High School (East Side)

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Denning Elementary School (North Side)

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: West Frankfort Park Aquatic Center Parking Lot

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Antioch United Methodist Church Parking Lot Illinois Route 149 at 3013 Antioch Rd. east of W.F.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: St. Marks Episcopal Church South Parking Lot 212 N. Ida St. at W. St. Louis St.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Orient American Legion Post 1961 Parking Lot

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Pershing At the corner of Pershing Rd. and Country Club Rd.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: This will be the last message until Sunday night. Have a good weekend.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Sincerely,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Superintendent of Schools

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

br.p: PRESS RELEASE ** PRESS RELEASE ** PRESS RELEASE

p.strong: 2020 Frankfort Community Unit School District #168 Meeting Schedule - Revised

br.p: Due to the uncertainty of having a quorum available, the Regular Meeting for February of the Board of Education of Frankfort Community Unit School District #168 scheduled for Monday, February 24, 2020, is postponed and will be rescheduled for Tuesday, February 25, 2020. The meeting will begin at 6:00 p.m. in the Library at Central Junior High School.

This change results in the following updated list of regularly scheduled meetings of the Frankfort CUSD #168 Board of Education between February 17 and December 31 of 2020 originally approved at the Regular Board Meeting held on Monday, December 16, 2019:

* Tuesday, February 25, 2020
Monday, March 16, 2020
Monday, April 20, 2020
Monday, May 18, 2020
Monday, June 15, 2020
Monday, July 20, 2020
Monday, August 17, 2020
Monday, September 21, 2020
Monday, October 26, 2019
Monday, November 16, 2020
Monday, December 21, 2020

Unless otherwise notified with the proper and timely notice, the meetings will be held at 6:00 p.m. in the Library of Central Junior High School, located at 1500 East Ninth Street in West Frankfort, Illinois. Meetings are generally held on the Third Mondays unless there is a holiday. Any adjustments of the Regular Meeting schedule with a change of venue, date, time, or location will result in specific notice to our partners in the media in the proper time frame.

This list of Regular Session Meetings is provided as required in accordance with the Illinois Open Meetings Act. Any special meetings held during the year will have timely notice distributed from this office.

Contact: Matt Donkin, Superintendent of Schools
(Office phone) (618) 937-2421
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

p.span: Contact Us

br.br:
The School District, in an active partnership with parents and community, will promote excellence in a caring environment in which all students learn and grow. This partnership shall empower all students to develop a strong self-esteem and to become responsible learners and decision-makers. The School District is committed to developing and using visionary and innovative curriculum, a knowledgeable and dedicated staff, and sound fiscal and management practices.
Frankfort Community Unit School District No. 168 is an Equal Opportunity Provider.

span.style: font-size: 22px;
text-align: justify;
font-size: 13px;

This partnership shall empower all students to develop a strong self-esteem and to become responsible learners and decision-makers. The School District is committed to developing and using visionary and innovative curriculum, a knowledgeable and dedicated staff, and sound fiscal and management practices.
